title: Mourning the death of Herbert F. Faurote, the longest serving fire chief in the State of New York
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  mourning  the  death of Herbert F. Faurote, the
longest serving fire chief in the State of New York, distinguished citi-
zen and devoted member of his community

WHEREAS, It is the custom of this Legislative Body  to  pay  tribute  to
citizens  of  the  State  of  New York whose lifework and civic endeavor
served to enhance the quality of life in their communities and the great
State of New York; and
  WHEREAS, Herbert F. Faurote, Chief of the Bloomington Fire  Department
for  the  past 45 years, died on Wednesday, June 23, 2010, at the age of
82; and
  WHEREAS, Born on March 19, 1928, in Poughkeepsie, New York, Herbert F.
Faurote was the son of the late Hubert and Dorothy Griffen Faurote; and
  WHEREAS, Herbert F. Faurote distinguished himself  in  his  profession
and  by  his  sincere  dedication  and  substantial  contribution to the
welfare of his community; and
  WHEREAS, A lifelong area resident, Herbert F. Faurote was employed  as
auto  parts  sales  manager  for  the H.F. King Corp. in Kingston for 42
years prior to his retirement; and
  WHEREAS, Herbert F. Faurote's commitment to excellence, and his spirit
of humanity, carried over into all fields of enterprise, including char-
itable and civic endeavors; and
  WHEREAS, Herbert F. Faurote began his fire service career joining  the
Bloomington  Fire  Department in 1961, working his way through the ranks
and becoming chief on January 1, 1965, a  position  he  held  until  his
death; and
  WHEREAS,  He  also  served  the  department as past president and past
treasurer and was serving as deputy fire coordinator for  Ulster  County
at the time of his death; and
  WHEREAS,  Herbert  F.  Faurote  was a member of the Ulster County Fire
Chief's Association, Ulster County Fireman's Association, New York State
Association of Fire Coordinators, the Ulster County Fire Advisory  Board
and the Town of Rosendale Volunteer Fireman's Association; and
  WHEREAS,  Herbert  F.  Faurote was a veteran of the United States Navy
and served in the United States Naval Reserve Unit in  Poughkeepsie  for
38 years, retiring as chief petty officer in 1987; and
  WHEREAS,  He  was  serving  as  president of the Bloomingdale Cemetery
Association and was a former deacon of the  United  Reformed  Church  of
Rosendale; and
  WHEREAS,  Predeceased  by  his  parents,  Hubert  and  Dorothy Griffen
Faurote and one brother, Lloyd, Herbert F. Faurote is  survived  by  his
wife  of  63  years,  Rose  M.  Smith  Faurote;  one  daughter, Mary Lou
Faurote-Fuggazi; his niece whom he raised, Paulette  Romano;  a  sister,
Betty  Jean  Stagg;  three  brothers,  Robert, Walter and Richard; and a
granddaughter, a great-granddaughter, several nieces, nephews and  cous-
ins as well as his large family of firefighters; and
  WHEREAS,  Armed  with  a  humanistic  spirit,  imbued  with a sense of
compassion, and comforted by a loving family, Herbert F. Faurote  leaves
behind  a  legacy  which  will  long endure the passage of time and will
remain as a comforting memory to all  he  served  and  befriended;  now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
mourn the death of Herbert F. Faurote, the longest serving fire chief in
the State of New York, distinguished citizen and devoted member  of  his
community; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to the family of Herbert F. Faurote.
